intro: Gilia tularensis, commonly known as the Tule Gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, showy flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small, oval-shaped fruits that contain several seeds. Gilia tularensis is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton.
